text: Katie Mackey (born November 12, 1987) is an American middle-distance runner. Mackey placed 8th at 2018 IAAF World Indoor Championships – Women's 3000 metres. ==Career== ===2018 season=== Mackey won a US national xc title over 6 km in 19:35 at 2018 USATF National Club Cross Country Championships.2018 USATF National Club Cross Country Championships - December 8, 2018 - Plantes Ferry Sports Complex - Spokane, WA USATF Mackey placed 6th in the 5000 m in 15:39.25 at 2018 USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships.2018 USATF Championships Results - 6/21/2018 to 6/24/2018 Drake Stadium USATF Mackey finished 2nd in the 3,000 meters at the 2018 USA Indoor Track and Field Championships, qualifying her for the 2018 IAAF World Indoor Championships where she placed 8th.Former Fort Collins High star qualifies for world indoor championships ===2017 season=== In 2017, Mackey won the U.S. road mile championship.Katie Mackey Wins First National Title After Nearly Quitting the Sport | Runner's World ===2016 season=== She finished 6th at the 2016 United States Olympic Trials (track and field) in the 5,000 meters. ===2015 season=== Mackey placed 6th in 5000 m final in 15:16.96 at 2015 USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships2015 USATF Championships Results - 6/25/2015 to 6/28/2015 Hayward Field, Eugene, Oregon USATF Mackey won the 2015 Stockholm Bauhaus Athletics 3,000 meter 2015 IAAF Diamond League event.Katie Mackey Wins in Stockholm; David Oliver Gets Upset ===2014 season=== Mackey placed 3rd in 1500 m final in 4:07.70 at 2014 USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships.2014 USA Track & Field Championships Results - 6/25/2014 to 6/29/2014 Hornet Stadium - Sacramento, California USATF Mackey won a silver medal at the 2014 IAAF World Relays in the women's 4 × 1500 metres relay.Mackey, U.S. team finish 2nd in 6,000-meter relay Mackey placed 8th in 5000 m at the 2014 IAAF Continental Cup in the 5000 m. ===2013 season=== Katie Mackey placed 8th in 15:57.78 in the 5000 m final and 9th in 4:32.10 in the 1500 m final at the 2013 USA Outdoor Track and Field Championships.2013 USA Track & Field Championships Results - 6/19/2013 to 6/23/2013 Drake Stadium - Des Moines, Iowa USATF ===2012 season=== Katie Mackey placed 11th in the 1500 m at the 2012 United States Olympic Trials (track and field) in 4:11.46 and DNS in 5000 m.2012 United States Olympic Trials 1500 m final results USATF ===2008 season=== Katie Follett placed 21st in the 1500 m at the 2008 United States Olympic Trials (track and field) in 4:22.60. ==College career== At the University of Washington Mackey was an eight-time All-American.Former Fort Collins runner Katie Mackey misses Rio bid by one spot – The Denver Post {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !colspan="7" | Representing University of Washington |- ! School Year !! Pac-12 Conference Cross Country Championship !! NCAA Division 1 Cross Country Championship !! Mountain Pacific Sports Federation Indoor track and field Championship !! Katie Follett an 11-time conference champion, 13-time regional champion, and 11-time all-state performer in both cross country and track for Fort Collins High School.KATIE FOLLETT, SENIOR, FORT COLLINS HIGH SCHOOL Katie set Fort Collins school records in the 3200 m (10:47.51) and 3200 m relay, and at 5 km in cross country (18:16).Kate Mackey Track and Field Records MileSplit Katie won the 3200 m at the 2004 Kansas Relays and was second in the 1600 m. ==References== Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Fort Collins, Colorado Category:American female middle-distance runners Category:American female long-distance runners Category:University of Washington alumni Category:Washington Huskies women's track and field athletes Category:World Athletics Championships athletes for the United States
